title: Professor
shortBio: Professor Joran Albright leads design studios that adapt riverfront structures to changing climates and community needs.
publications: Albright, J. (2024). Modular span systems for tidal bridges. Journal of Fictional Engineering.
Albright, J., & Crest, J. (2023). Participatory levee retrofits. Riverworks Review.
Albright, J. (2022). Equity metrics in river infrastructure procurement. Cascadia Infrastructure Quarterly.

title: Associate Professor
shortBio: Dr. Evan Stroud focuses on resilient structural systems and passenger experience planning for river mobility corridors.
publications: Stroud, E. (2024). Real-time monitoring of pedestrian bridges. International Journal of Imaginary Sensors.
Stroud, E., & Merat, L. (2023). Ferry terminal UX design. Mobility Futures.
Stroud, E. (2022). Accessibility audits for river crossings. Harborbend Planning Digest.

title: Professor
shortBio: Professor Samira Quell directs the Hydro Systems Lab, where interdisciplinary teams design circular water infrastructure.
publications: Quell, S. (2025). Designing equitable water reuse districts. Journal of Imagined Sustainability.
Quell, S., & Dhor, K. (2023). Membrane bioreactors in tidal cities. Synthetic Water Works.
Quell, S. (2022). Policy frameworks for circular sanitation. Cascadia Urban Review.

title: Associate Professor
shortBio: Dr. Theron Blake investigates robotic fabrication techniques for rapid-response river infrastructure.

Blake, T., & Hollin, K. (2023). Adaptive automation for flood defense. River Tech Today.
Blake, T. (2022). Modular robotics in disaster recovery. Cascadia Innovation Journal.

title: Professor
shortBio: Professor Kyra Hollin mentors engineering teams exploring advanced materials and automation for sustainable manufacturing.

title: Senior Lecturer
shortBio: Dr. Livia Merat collaborates with transit agencies to co-design inclusive river mobility systems and logistics plans.

title: Professor
